tiltDevTools 0.0.0.9004

Extend use_dictionary() for objects of class 'tilt_profile'

Source: R/use_dictionary.R
use_dictionary.Rd

Create a dictionary

Usage

# S3 method for tilt_profile
use_dictionary(data, ...)

Arguments

data

A data frame or list of data frames.

...

Unused but necessary to support for extensions.

Value

A tibble::tibble.

See also

rsetools::use_dictionary().

Examples

library(tiltIndicator)
library(rsetools)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘rsetools’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:tiltDevTools’:
#> 
#>     use_pr_checklist

# Fake output of a tilt indicator profile
product <- data.frame(companies_id = "a", product_col = 1)
company <- data.frame(companies_id = "a", company_col = 2)
nested <- nest_levels(product, company)
nested
#> # A tibble: 1 × 3
#>   companies_id product          company         
#>   <chr>        <list>           <list>          
#> 1 a            <tibble [1 × 1]> <tibble [1 × 1]>

nested |> class()
#> [1] "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame"
# Not what you want
nested |> use_dictionary()
#> # A tibble: 3 × 4
#>   dataset name         type      definition
#>   <chr>   <chr>        <chr>     <chr>     
#> 1 nested  companies_id character NA        
#> 2 nested  product      list      NA        
#> 3 nested  company      list      NA        

profile <- nested |> tilt_profile()
profile |> class()
#> [1] "tilt_profile" "tbl_df"       "tbl"          "data.frame"  
# Yes what you want
profile |> use_dictionary()
#> # A tibble: 4 × 4
#>   dataset         name         type      definition
#>   <chr>           <chr>        <chr>     <chr>     
#> 1 profile_product companies_id character NA        
#> 2 profile_product product_col  double    NA        
#> 3 profile_company companies_id character NA        
#> 4 profile_company company_col  double    NA
